thread.title: Christians targeted, executed by Oregon shooter
thread.title_full: Christians targeted, executed by Oregon shooter - seattlepi.com

author: John Boyd
title: Christians targeted, executed by Oregon shooter
text:
Related Stories 'We began to run': Students describe horror of shooting The Latest: Shooter had 3 pistols, rifle, 5 extra magazines Witnesses at the scene of Thursday's deadly campus shooting at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, Ore. say alleged shooter Chris Harper-Mercer executed victims who told him they were Christian.
"[He started] asking people one by one what their religion was. 'Are you a Christian?' he would ask them, and if you're a Christian, stand up," Stacy Boylen, whose daughter was wounded in the shooting, told CNN. "And they would stand up and he said, 'Good, because you're a Christian, you are going to see God in just about one second.' And then he shot and killed them."
PHOTOS: America has a long history of mass shootings
#UCCShooting pic.twitter.com/RVtzkWVSPu
â€” Bodhi (@BodhiLooney) October 1, 2015 Victims who answered "no" were instead shot in the leg, said Twitter user @BodhiLooney, whose grandmother was on campus during the shooting Thursday and unsuccessfully attempted to perform CPR on one of the victims, who later died.
Nine victims were killed in the campus shooting, which took place about 180 miles south of Portland. At least seven more were injured. Harper-Mercer was also killed in a shootout with police.
RELATED: Obama decries 'routine' response of country to shootings
According to the New York Post , Harper-Mercer maintained an online dating profile in which he stated he "doesn't like organized religion." Other online profiles showed a strong interest in Nazi history and the Irish Republican Army (IRA).
Mercer's father says he's as shocked as anybody at the deaths of 10 people including his son.
Ian Mercer spoke to KABC-TV and several other media outlets gathered outside his house in Tarzana, California late Thursday night.
He said it's been a "devastating day" for him and his family and said he has been talking to police and the FBI about the shooting.
He refused to answer questions and asked that his family's privacy be respected.
Authorities say the gunman opened fire at Umpqua Community College, killing nine before dying during an exchange of gunfire with officers.
A government official identified the killer as Chris Harper Mercer. The official provided the name on condition of anonymity because he was not authorized to speak publicly.
The Associated Press contributed to this report.
